dlgLine.text: Hey...

dlgAnsw.text: Anything that would improve your mood?
I brought you your medication.
Ryan, I found this picture on one of the corpses.
I brought you the English to Japanese dictionary you wanted.
Have time for some questions?
Just checking on you. See you later.

dlgLine.text: What do you want?

dlgAnsw.text: Anything that would improve your mood?
I brought you your medication.
I brought you the English to Japanese dictionary you wanted.
Ryan, I found this picture on one of the corpses.
Have time for some questions?
Nothing. Excuse me.

dlgLine.text: I guess...

dlgAnsw.text: What happened before I found you in the diner?
What kind of skills do you have?
What would you like to see at the shelter?
That's all for now. See ya.

dlgLine.text: Um... We weren't supposed to be there... It's just... We were supposed to be on a plane back to Wisconsin, but it was canceled. One day sooner and we would have been home! I guess...

My dad got us a hotel room in Dallas - I guess he paid a lot for it, because people kept saying they were all sold out. But... they evacuated us the next day on a bus. Kept saying it wasn't going to be safe in the city much longer.
Do you really want to hear this? Because I don't like talking about it.

dlgAnsw.text: Please...
Let's talk about something else, okay?
No, that's enough. We'll talk later.

dlgLine.text: Um... So, um... We were on the bus and I guess I fell asleep... The next thing I know, I wake up and the bus is moving, but there's nobody on and there's Mark arguing with the driver to get over. The driver was bleeding and he had a gun.

We crashed. The driver was dead, I think. We left him. Michiru was the only one on the bus besides us. Mark got us to follow him and he followed signs to the truck stop. There was one of those dead people in the parking lot...
Mark saved my life. I was still in shock and it grabbed me. If Mark hadn't shot it in the head...

Anyhow... I lost my family that day. Mark... Mark saw the attack, while the bus was stopped. <Sniff> He said there were dozens of corpses that attacked... <Sniff> My mom, my dad, my sister... They were out there when the bus left...

dlgAnsw.text: Let's talk about something else.
I'm sorry. I should go.

dlgLine.text: I don't know... I'm still in high school. Or... I was. I know how to waterski - does that count?

dlgAnsw.text: Let me ask you something else.
That'll come in handy... I gotta go.

dlgLine.text: Um... How about somewhere to relax? Somewhere that feels like nothing shitty happened. And like... like we can watch TV or play some games. I don't know... that's kind of what I'd want.

dlgAnsw.text: Can I ask you something else?
Right. I'll see what I can do. Later.

dlgLine.text: Thanks. I already feel better. This should last awhile too.
Sorry again about not telling you... It was just embarrassing. I hate feeling helpless. I just want to contribute like everyone else.

dlgAnsw.text: You put me and a lot of others through a lot of grief. Next time you have a problem, you tell me.
It's okay. Don't worry about it. We'll talk later.

dlgLine.text: I know... Sorry. I already feel shitty about this.

dlgAnsw.text: We'll talk later.
I have to go.

dlgLine.text: This is... My dad carried this around in his wallet...
They are dead... Aren't they?

dlgAnsw.text: I thought you should know.
I put them down myself.
If I were you, I would want to know the truth.

dlgLine.text: I kind of did...

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Well... I'm okay with that.

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Yeah...

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: Um... I'd like to be alone now, please.

dlgAnsw.text: Sure. I'm sorry, Ryan. I'll see you later.
Of course. Excuse me.

dlgLine.text: Um... I'd like some rechargeable batteries for my XoDS. And, I guess I could use some deodorant - you know, to smell good for the ladies here.

dlgAnsw.text: I've got some rechargeable batteries right here.
Here's some deodorant.
I'll see what I can find.

dlgLine.text: Thanks. It gets so boring around here sometimes, so playing games helps. Wish my phone worked, though...

dlgAnsw.text: You're welcome.
Don't get too distracted. See ya.

dlgLine.text: Yeah, awesome. Girls really dig it when you spray on a whole lot of this.

dlgAnsw.text: Glad I could help.
They sure do.
Ha.... <whisper to self>No, we don't.

dlgLine.text: I really don't feel like talking right now.

dlgAnsw.text: <Ryan crosses his arms and looks down at the floor.>

dlgLine.text: Leave me alone...

dlgAnsw.text: Let's talk, okay?
What the hell's the matter with you?

dlgLine.text: I thought I could do it. But... I can't look at them. I just see the dead and all I can think about is my family.
I don't want to be scared but I can't help it! I can't do it... I can't deal with it! <Ryan starts to cry.>

dlgAnsw.text: It's alright, Ryan... I've lost people too.
It's alright, Ryan... It took me awhile too.
I didn't want to bring you out. You asked.
Man the fuck up. Do you want to live?
If you can't hold it together around the dead, why should I keep you around here?

dlgLine.text: <Sniff>...You have? How do you do it then? How do you not think about how everyone and everything is gone?

dlgAnsw.text: I know they would want me to live. So that's what I focus on.
I focus on protecting the people here.
I take out my anger on the dead.

dlgLine.text: <Sniff>...It did? How do you do it then? How do you not think about how everyone and everything is gone?

dlgAnsw.text: I want to live. That's what I focus on.
I focus on protecting the people here.
I take out my anger on the dead.

dlgLine.text: <Sniff>I know - sorry. I thought I could do it.
I don't know how Mark and everyone does it. How do you forget it? How do you look at those things and just think about how everything is gone?

dlgAnsw.text: I want to live. That's what I focus on.
I focus on protecting the people here.
I take out my anger on the dead.

dlgLine.text: Of course I do! <Sniff> I just... can't stop thinking about my parents... my sister... They're...
What do you want me to do?! How do you go on when everyone's dead?

dlgAnsw.text: I want to live. That's what I focus on.
I focus on protecting the people here.
I take out my anger on the dead.
Sit here and be a whiny bitch then. See if I care.

dlgLine.text: <Sniff>I don't know... I don't know what I'm supposed to do. They're gone... Everyone's dead or going to be dead. What does it matter anymore...
So now what? I've lost everything. So now the fuck what?!

dlgAnsw.text: I want to live - that's my priority.
Take your anger out on the dead. It's what I do.
Sit here and be a whiny bitch then. See if I care.

dlgLine.text: I don't understand... What can I do?

dlgAnsw.text: Help others here.
Learn to fight.

dlgLine.text: I can't do it... Every time one of them gets near me, I just want to run.

dlgAnsw.text: Run to what? This is it, kid. You kill them or they will kill you.
Then you need to help others here as much as possible.

dlgLine.text: Help them how? I don't know how to do anything. What am I supposed to do?

dlgAnsw.text: Start studying a science text - I need a lab assistant.
I could use a mechanic around here.
Start studying your maps and edible plants - we'll make a survival expert out of you yet.
We can never have too many medics.

dlgLine.text: Wait...

dlgAnsw.text: - New Answ -

dlgLine.text: I guess... I guess you're right. That's what everyone did back at the bus stop - run. Maybe if they had fought, my family would...
Look, I'll do better next time. Next time I see a corpse around me... I'll pay them back for what they did to me. I swear...

dlgAnsw.text: Good. Because that's how you survive. Now... Go get some practice in - we'll talk later.
You remember what's at stake and use it to your advantage. I'll be seeing you.

dlgLine.text: Okay... I'll do that. I swear - I'll spend every waking moment practicing if it makes me useful.

dlgAnsw.text: I'm glad you figured out what you want to do. I'll check on you later.
That's a mature way to handle it. I'm proud of you. Go on - we'll talk more when you're ready.

dlgLine.text: Okay... I'll do that. I swear - I'll spend every waking moment practicing if it makes me useful.

dlgAnsw.text: I'm glad you figured out what you want to do. I'll check on you later.
That's a mature way to handle it. I'm proud of you. Go on - we'll talk more when you're ready.

dlgLine.text: Okay... I'll do that. I swear - I'll spend every waking moment practicing if it makes me useful.

dlgAnsw.text: I'm glad you figured out what you want to do. I'll check on you later.
That's a mature way to handle it. I'm proud of you. Go on - we'll talk more when you're ready.

dlgLine.text: Okay... I'll do that. I swear - I'll spend every waking moment practicing if it makes me useful.

dlgAnsw.text: I'm glad you figured out what you want to do. I'll check on you later.
That's a mature way to handle it. I'm proud of you. Go on - we'll talk more when you're ready.

dlgLine.text: Oh, awesome - this should really speed up our lessons.

dlgAnsw.text: Good luck. Talk to you later.
I hope it was worth the trip. See ya.
